meaning: Glory be to Allah and Praise Him
ibadah: Whoever says (the above) at morning and evening time, one hundred times, none shall come on the Day of Resurrection with anything better except someone who has said the same or more.

zikr: سُبْحَانَ اللّهِ وَ بِحَمْدِهِ ، سُبْحَانَ اللّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
meaning: Glory be to Allah, and Praise, Glory be to Allah, the Supreme
ibadah: Prophet Muhammad said: “Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, they are loved by the Most Merciful One.”
Whoever recites [the above] one Hundred times, a thousand good deeds are recorded for him or a thousand bad deeds are wiped away.

zikr: لا حَوْلَ وَ لا قُوَّةَ اِلَّا بِاللّهِ
pronounce: La Hawla wa la Quwatta illa Billah
meaning: There is no Might or Power except with Allah
ibadah: [the above is] a treasure from the treasures of Paradise.

zikr: سُبْحَانَ اللّهِ ، والْحَمْدُللّهِ ، وَ لا اِلهَ اِلَّا اللّهُ ، وَ اللّهُ اَكْبَرُ
pronounce: SubhanAllah, walHamdulilah, wa La illaha ilAllahu, waAllahu Akbar
meaning: Glory be to Allah, All Praise is for Allah, There is No God but Allah, Allah is the Greatest
ibadah: The above are mentioned as the four most beloved words to Allah. It does not matter with which one of them is begun.

zikr: سُبْحَانَ اللّهِ ، والْحَمْدُللّهِ ، وَ لا اِلهَ اِلَّا اللّهُ ، وَ اللّهُ اَكْبَرُ ، وَ لا حَوْلَ وَ لا قُوَّةَ اِلَّا بِاللّهِ
pronounce: SubhanAllah, walHamdulilah, wa La illaha ilAllahu, waAllahu Akbar, wa la Hawla wa la quwwata illa billah
meaning: Glory be to Allah, All Praise is for Allah, There is No God but Allah, Allah is the Greatest, There is no might or any power Except with Allah
ibadah: (The above) are the good deeds which endure [al-baqiyaatuS-SaliHaat]

meaning: There is No God But Allah
ibadah: Abu Huraira reported that the Prophet said: “When a servant of Allah utters the words la ilaha illallah (there is no God except Allah) sincerely, the doors of heaven open up for these words until they reach the Throne of Allah, so long as its utterer keeps away from the major sins.”

zikr: لا اِلهَ اِلَّا اللّهُ وَحْدَهُ لا شَرِيكَ لَهُ ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَ هُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
pronounce: La illaha ilAllahu, waHdahu la shareeka lahu, lahul Mulku, wa lahul Hamd, wa Huwa ala kulli shaiy’in Qadeer
meaning: There is No God But Allah Alone, who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the raise, and He is Able to do all things
ibadah: Whoever says the above ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma’il ..
